title: 3 Books That Taught Me More Than My MBA: Key Insights for Financial Success
subtitle: Discover the top lessons from three influential books that can drive your business acumen and personal brand, emphasizing free value and authenticity.
content:
3 Books That Taught Me More Than My MBA

Tyler, I'm a former financial advisor and portfolio manager, and now I make financial content for free so that you don't have to pay for it.

1. Tim Ferriss' The 4-Hour Workweek

Number one takeaway: Stop spending life checking email and allowing other people's agendas to become your daily to-do list.

2. Phil Knight's Shoe Dog

Number one takeaway: Fail quickly. You have an idea, and you will never know if it's a good idea or a bad idea, no matter how smart you think you are, until that idea meets a real customer.

3. Deb Gabor's Irrational Loyalty

Number one takeaway: If you want to build a personal brand and establish authority in your field, give away every single piece of knowledge and value you have for one year. Here’s the punchline: for free. No courses, no paywalls, no subscription service nonsense for VIP access only. All free, all year.

You’ll never have to worry about money or authority again. And if any of this is helpful, sign up for my free newsletter where every Sunday morning, I'll keep trying to get you one step closer to where you need to be.
